Memorandum•- I forward herewith copy of a letter from the Director of Customs and -^ort officer, Bahrain, addressed to K.S.Yusuf bin Ahmed Kanoo on the subject of the agency of the steamship line of Mitsui Bussan Kaisha Ltd., for your information. Dear Jir, In reply t 9 your application No.Cl/ll of this date, I am instructed to inform you that there is no objection to your acting as the Bahrain Agent of ihe Mitsui Bussan Kaisha Ltd r s steamship Line, provided that the local reaulations and the sanctioned schedule of Landing charges, witn which you are already fully informed, are duly observed. I am, dear oir, Yours faithfully, Sd/ G.C.L.degrenier Director of Customs, and Port Officer. Bahrain:On 25th February 1936 by P.A*s order 1 interviewed MT*Obha, Agent of ihe Mitsui liussan js.aisha bine, luring the conversation najji iviuhaminad Taiyib js.hunji called to see P*A* and h.M* sent me a note to say that najji Muhammad iaiyib Khunji wanted to see P*A. about his being an Agent for the Mitsui, in the meantime Mr»Obha had arranged an interview with p # A* and the Adviser to the Bahrain government and had chosen jshan ^ahib xusuf bin Ahmad j^anoo to act as a shipping Agent for the Mitsui nussan j^aisha nine. in view of the above i saw no good could come of najji Muhammad ^aiyib *Jiunji l s interviewing P.A. and told jti.M* to tell riajji Muhammad j-aiyin Khunji that as wir.ubha had seen i^.A. personally about this matter there was no need for him to see r.A* hajji .Muhammad xaiyib i^hunji was informed accordingly and he left the office without making any remarks* 16.3.1936Shipping Telephone: Office 25001 —25052 Private 44803 Telegrams: ..BENITO” Boe Code OSLO, (Norway) P. T must kindly aslc you to excuse me for troubling you with this, and aeh you in anticipation to accept my best thaaikc for your Jdndneoe. Yourc Tory truly- For & on behalf cf , GUNNAR M. NIFL$EN (SHIPNo* 3129-12/13 Political Agency, Bahrain the 23rd December 1936 From Lieutenant-Colonel Gordon Loch, C.I.E., Political Agent, Bahrain. To The Honourable the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire. Sir I have the honour to enclose a copy of a letter dated the 1st November 1936 from Messrs Gunnar M. NieIsen(Shipping) Comoany, Oslo, to the Harbour Master, Bahrain. the material for a reply is given below:- (i) The Mesopotamia Persia Corporation Limited, Manamah, who are Lloyd*s Agents, deal with all local business relating to:- Shipbrokers; steamship-agency; tally firms; boatmen; ship- chandlers; shipping butchers; average adjusters; and temporary ship reoairs of a minor character, (ii) A supply of oil fuel may possibly be obtained by special orevious arrangement. No coal fuel is available. (iii) No tug company work is done in Bahrain as local conditions no not necessitate it. (iv) A local native pilot may be hired but such a person is uncertificated and not a qualified 2 . No reply has been sent to Messrs Gunnar M Nielsen 3 Should it be considered desirable to reply master2 1 master mariner, and speaks only Arabic. I have the honour to be, Sir, Your most obedient servant, Lieutenant-Colonel, Political Agent, Bahrain. i A-Ty 4 * ^ GOVERNMENT OF BAHRAIN. D.O.No. A'S'i- i3 /22. March 16, 1942. I enclose copies of correspondence between the Director of Customs and Yousuf Kanoo* It is true that Yousuf Kanoo has no staff or craft for undertaking this work and Gray, Mackenzie & Company are fully qualified to do it* If any importance is attached to efficiency in handling these steamers I think Gray, Mackenzie & Company would be more competent and effective than Yousuf Kanoo. I am reluctant however to deal with the matter myself as foreign interests are concerned and also I feel quite sure that Yousuf Kanoo would regard any suggestion of this kind from me as a personal matter so I would be grateful if you would give an opinion on the matter. E. B. Wakefield, Esquire, I.C.S., H. B. M*s Political Agent, Bahrain.My dear Belgrave, I am aorry for the delay in replying to your D«0«letter No*433-13/23,dated the 16th March,1942. If the Shipping Companies referred to in the enclosure to your letter want to employ K*S-Haji Vusu' Kanoo as their agent I can see no objection to t heir being allowed to do so. If their business is handled inefficiently, they will no doubt pppoint another agent in due course. If necessary,i.e. if inefficient handling of their steamers affects adversely work in the port, they could be advised to change their agent. Yours sincerely To C.Dalrymple Belgrave Ksq.,C.B.E., The Adviser, Government of Bahrein, Bahrein.■■■■ H. /> C r \ no. Office or the Ad of 1361 Adviser to the Government, Bahrain Dated, 21st R/Awal, 1361 April 8, 1942. h.' y <^3 V li. B. M’s Political Agent, i. Bahrain. Memorandum: - With reference to my D.O. No. 433-13/23 dated 16th March 1942, I enclose a copy of the Aalan regarding Shipping Agents, for your information. Haj Yousuf bin Ahmed Kanoo has been informed that he may take up the Agency. Adviser to the Government. ©1 Copy of Beihrain Government Aalan No, 28/1351 dated 24th j/Thani 1351 (24th October 1932). 1. The public are informed that no one is permitted to become an Agent for a Shipping or Air Company in Bahrain or Agent of any ship that loads or unloads cargo or passengers in Beihrain without obtaining permission from the Government. 2. No one is allowed to load or unload passengers or cargo in Bahrain waters unless he obtains permission from the Government to do so. 3. All applications should be in writing and submitted to the Director of Customs and Port Officer. S.Z.DEPT. BRANCH. 19 ; Nos. Subject. AGENCIES FOR FOREIGN STEAM SHIP COMPANIES. MGIPC—Sl-1027 (CP 3)HFP-(.M:.763)-21-8-34—e,00,000

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘File 12/13 Shipping. Agents for foreign steamship companies’

physicalDescription.extent: The file’s contents are arranged in approximate chronological order, from the earliest item at the front to the latest at the end. The file notes at the end of the file (ff 18-20) mirror the chronological arrangement.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 21; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file comprises correspondence relating to foreign shipping companies operating at Bahrain, and agents representing foreign shipping companies operating at Bahrain. Correspondents in the file include: the Political Agent at Bahrain (chiefly Lieutenant-Colonel Percy Gordon Loch; Edward Birkbeck Wakefield); Yusuf bin Ahmed Kanoo [Yūsuf bin Aḥmad Kānū]; the Adviser to the Government of Bahrain (Charles Dalrymple Belgrave); the Director of Customs at Bahrain (Claud Cranbrook Lewis DeGrenier).The file includes:correspondence dated 1936 relating to an application made by Hajy Muhammad Tayeb Khunji to act as a shipping agent for the Japanese Mitsui Bussan Kaisha company’s steamship line at Bahrain, rejected in favour of an application made by Yusuf bin Ahmed Kanoo (ff 3-6);correspondence dated 1936 relating to a request by the Norwegian Gunnar M Nielsen Shipping Company, for the names of shipbrokers, stevedores, pilots and other port-related operatives at Bahrain (ff 7-9);correspondence dated 1942 relating to Yusuf bin Ahmed Kanoo’s appointment as shipping agent for the Netherlands Shipping Committee (time chartered by the British Ministry of War Transport), including the Political Agent’s and Bahrain Government Adviser’s questioning of Kanoo’s experience for the role (ff 10-16);a copy of a Bahrain Government notice, dated 24 October 1932, stating that no one is permitted to become an agent for shipping at Bahrain, without first obtaining the permission of the Bahrain Government (f 15);a letter from Yusuf bin Ahmed Kanoo to the Director of Customs at Bahrain, dated 23 September 1950, informing that he has been appointed agent for vessels owned by the Alexandria Navigation Company (f 17).

name.namePart: Adviser to the Government of Bahrain
Director of Customs and Port Officer
